document_data.name: Blood Mantle
document_data.mainbody: '''''Blood mantle''''' was a [[Divine magic|divine]] [[alteration]] and [[necromancy]] [[spell]] used only by specialty priests devoted to [[Garagos]] called [[Bloodreaver]]s.
document_data.Effects: This spell called into being a shroud of blood droplets swirling around the caster. The droplets would coagulate into an [[iron]] wall to intercept any physical attacks aimed at the caster. A ''blood mantle'' was very conductive to electricity, posing a risk for the caster while active against that form of attack. The caster was able to hurl the mantle up to {{SI|10|ft}} away to form a {{SI|10|ft}} curtain of blood to serve as a protective wall similar to the ''[[wall of iron]]'' spell but not susceptible to any rust attacks. Once thrown the ''blood mantle'' could not be moved for the spell's duration.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required as [[material component]]s the priest's [[holy symbol]] and a red [[gemstone]] worth at least 24 [[gp]] to cast.
